markdownRemark.excerpt: First NPM package published Open Source Software For me, Open Source Software is the first choice most of the time. There’s just something…
markdownRemark.html:
First NPM package published

Open Source Software

For me, Open Source Software is the first choice most of the time. There’s just something about it. Not only it provides tooling in day-to-day life also one can become a contributor to the ecosystem. There are other bonuses like the possibility to read and inspect the source code as well as opportunity to learning from it.

However, I was just a user or observer of the system for a long time. I have had created a few issue tickets around some functionality and even contributed some code to someone elses repository. I always have had this urge to create something but I didn’t know what.

The package

So I decided to do better. It took me 5 hours to complete this project in total. It’s a simple utility package that provides its users with the ability to get currency names, symbols, and other meta-data in the required locale (ISO 4217, ISO 3166‑1). https://www.npmjs.com/package/currency-list And I published it.

frontmatter.title: Closrure Or It is what it is.
